'''Robert M. Astley''' (born 1944), a Fellow of the  [[Canadian Institute of Actuaries]], is the chairman of the [[Canada Pension Plan Investment Board]].

==Biography==
Astley  has been a director of the  [[Canada Pension Plan Investment Board|CPP Investment Board]] since September 2006, and succeeded its Chairmen of the Board, [[Gail Cook-Bennett]], effective October 2008.<ref>http://www.cppib.ca/News_Room/News_Releases/nr_09050801.html</ref>

Astley  is also a Director of the [[Bank of Montreal]]  and chairman of its human resources and management compensation committee.

Astley was formerly the president of [[Sun Life Financial]] Canada, president and [[CEO]] of [[Clarica Life Insurance]] Company,  chair of [[Canadian Life and Health Insurance Association]].<ref>http://www.cppib.ca/About_Us/board_of_directors.html</ref> In 2004 he was succeeded by Kevin Dougherty.<ref>http://www.sunlife.com/Global/News+and+insights/News/News+releases/Archives/2004/Kevin+Dougherty+named+to+succeed+Bob+Astley+as+President+of+Sun+Life+Financial+Canada?vgnLocale=en_CA</ref>  Astley is also a former Chair of Wilfrid Laurier University, a former member of the Deanâ€™s Advisory Council, [[Laurier School of Business & Economics]] and a former Chair of the K-W Symphony.

Astley graduated from the [[University of Manitoba]] with an Honours degree in Science.<ref>http://www.bmo.com/home/about/banking/investor-relations/corporate-governance/board-of-directors#bob,</ref>

==Defamation suit==
{{main|Astley v. Verdun}}
On  May 31, 2011, the [[Toronto Star]] reported that Astley won $650,000 in a [[defamation]] suit against shareholder activist, [[Robert Verdun]].<ref>http://www.thestar.com/news/crime/article/1000462--bank-director-wins-650-000-in-defamation-suit-against-shareholder-activist</ref><ref>http://business.financialpost.com/2011/06/14/permanent-gag-order-issued-in-defamation-case-brought-by-cppib-chair/</ref><ref>http://www.canlii.org/en/on/onsc/doc/2011/2011onsc3651/2011onsc3651.html</ref>
